items.content_html: I used my iPad Pro and Pencil to teach my (kindergarten-age) daughter (üë©‚Äçüî¨) some bedtime math for the first time tonight. She loved writing the numbers in different colors in Apple Notes. I loved writing on something I could easily erase. It was really fun.
I just submitted SwiftoDo 2.12.0 to the App Store. Hopefully it‚Äôs good enough! üòÖ Expect a release toward the end of the week, if all goes well.
So much to do today, I don‚Äôt even know where to begin‚Ä¶
I took a new pair of headphones for a spin this evening. I think I may have a problem. üéßüòÇ
Blog post: ‚ÄúRecess‚Äù and ‚ÄúGood Bones‚Äù, or selling the world to my children

I‚Äôm still testing and fixing things in my dev build of SwiftoDo 2.12.0. It feels weird to have gone so long without issuing a release. I hope to get everything done next week. I have a very full weekend of family activities ahead of me, though, so I can‚Äôt do much till Monday.

items.title: üéµ Carry On
items.content_html:
On this bad and sad news day, remember:

If you‚Äôre lost and alone
Or you‚Äôre sinking like a stone
Carry on
May your past be the sound
Of your feed upon the ground and
Carry on

‚ÄòCause we are, we are shining stars
We are invincible
We are who we are
On our darkest day
When we‚Äôre miles away
So we‚Äôll come, we will find our way home

Fun.‚Äôs ‚ÄúCarry On‚Äù works well, and feels quite different, in this cover version by the cast of ‚ÄúRise‚Äù.

items.title: üéµ Frozen: The Broadway Musical
items.content_html: Listening to the cast recording of ‚ÄúFrozen: The Broadway Musical‚Äù for the first time is a bit surreal for me. Compared to the movie, there are new songs, lyrics changes in existing songs, and, of course, different singers. I don‚Äôt think any of the changes are for the better. It‚Äôs hard to say for sure, though, because, as a parent of a little girl, I‚Äôve heard the movie and the movie soundtrack about 1,000 times already, and it‚Äôs burned into my brain.

While I think I want a Nintendo Switch, I‚Äôm trying to make due for now with what I already have‚Äîan iPad Pro and a SteelSeries Nimbus controller. I‚Äôm not sure I even want to commit the time to gaming, but I am curious about the latest Mario and Zelda games.
Blog post: The calm before the WWDC storm
Google‚Äôs attractive but less information dense redesign of Google News may be the thing that finally breaks my addiction to it.

items.title: Google's music and video streaming strategy is a mess
items.content_html:
Engadget has it right. I have no idea what Google audio/video service I should ever consider subscribing to, and because music is tied in there, they don‚Äôt offer what I want (ad-free YouTube) at price that is reasonable to me. Maybe it doesn‚Äôt matter, because Google will just fold it and create an alternative service, with a different name, price, and product mix, in a couple years anyway.

As much as I rely on Google Search, and as much as I use, indifferently, Gmail, I just don‚Äôt understand Google as a company. Their central strategy appears to be ‚Äúno strategy‚Äù. They try stuff out, kill it if it fails, and iterate on what succeeds. This process is fun to watch when the company is a young startup, but is a bit much to bear when they are one of the four pillars of the internet.

If my kids didn‚Äôt love YouTube, but hate the ads, I wouldn‚Äôt think about subscribing to YouTube Premium (or is it YouTube Red? or is it YouTube Music?) at all. If Google cared about customers like me‚Äîvery light YouTube viewers who would pay a small amount of money to not be interrupted by ads‚ÄîI would send them some money each month.
My brain‚Äôs boot-up time is taking longer than usual today. ‚òïÔ∏è‚òïÔ∏è‚òïÔ∏è
The cast of Solo certainly is appealing, even if the movie itself may be largely inconsequential. To think, I used to care more about the director than the cast. üé¨
SwiftoDo 2.12.0 was looking pretty dire last night, but is now looking like it may be ready for release, thanks to some improvements I made today. I will do more testing this week to make sure.

Work has been heating up for me lately, which is good all around, but a change nonetheless. It‚Äôs good to have lots of work to look forward to each day. It‚Äôs bad to feel like there‚Äôs so much you can‚Äôt finish each day, too.
Am I late to the game with using semaphores, or are all the cool (cool?) kids using them these days?
I‚Äôm loving the second season of ‚ÄúWestworld‚Äù so far. I can‚Äôt wait to see how it all comes together in the end.

I have been testing what I thought would be SwiftoDo‚Äôs next release build all day. All day, Dropbox has been throwing error messages, making me think my code is messed up. Now, the same code is not throwing those error messages. It must be internet weather or something.
Today was a great Mother‚Äôs Day. Probably the best I can remember. We just spent it at home, and at my in-laws‚Äô home, with family.

items.title: From Spotify to Indie and Beyond: A Top Dev Interview With John Sundell
items.content_html: I enjoyed this interview with Swift expert, blogger, and podcaster John Sundell (@johnsundell): From Spotify to Indie and Beyond: A Top Dev Interview With John Sundell. I have learned a lot from John‚Äôs weekly blog, Swift by Sundell, in the past year or so, and always enjoy his contributions to the Swift programming community.

items.title: üéµ Frightened Rabbit singer commits suicide üò•
items.content_html:
(My original title was just an expletive.)

Body confirmed as missing Frightened Rabbit singer - BBC News:

‚ÄúDepression is a horrendous illness that does not give you any alert or indication as to when it will take hold of you‚Äù, it added.

‚ÄúScott battled bravely with his own issues for many years and we are immensely proud of him for being so open with his struggles.

‚ÄúHis willingness to discuss these matters in the public domain undoubtedly raised awareness of mental health issues and gave others confidence and belief to discuss their own issues.‚Äù

I‚Äôm so upset. I love Frightened Rabbit. It was no secret that Scott Hutchison suffered from depression, anxiety, and who knows what else‚Äîit‚Äôs all over his arch, wry lyrics. Go listen to ‚ÄúKeep Yourself Warm‚Äù to get an idea of what a great singer/songwriter he was.

items.title: Pure Gold from Pinboard's FAQ
items.content_html:
I came across this tonight, as I was perusing Pinboard‚Äôs FAQ, trying to learn something different about the service that I have been ignoring for the past year or so.

Is it true the site admin can see private bookmarks?

Yes. I routinely look at raw bookmark data, which includes private bookmarks. Most of the time this means I look at URLs without any identifying context.

I try to avoid looking at private data on people‚Äôs individual pages. However, this is sometimes necessary in order to diagnose and fix bugs in Pinboard, such as search errors, or strange formatting in archived pages.

I use the metaphor of a hotel manager. I have a key that opens every room, but I try not to use it without a good reason. And I can assure everyone that five years of running this site has eliminated any trace of curiosity I might have had about what people bookmark.

(Emphasis is my own. ü§£)
I decided to install some iOS games with MFi controller support on my iPad Pro. But‚Ä¶will I actually find time to play them? ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I discovered this great primer on the New York Times crossword puzzle (and crosswords in general) today. I wish I had known earlier that the Saturday puzzle, not the Sunday one, is the most difficult of the week.
